channel.title: Resumes on Mathematical Michael
channel.description: Recent content in Resumes on Mathematical Michael

item.title: Presentations
item.description: - In Chronological Order - 14th Annual SIAM Front Range Student Conference March 5, 2018 Talk: “What is an Inverse Problem?” 13th Annual SIAM Front Range Student Conference March 4, 2017 Primary Organizer as President of SIAM Student Chapter SIAM Conference on Computational Science and Engineering Feb 27-Mar 3, 2017 Poster: “Advancements in Simulation-Based Optimal Experimental Design” SIAM Front Range Student Conference March 5, 2016 Assisted with Organization as Vice President of SIAM Student Chapter Rocky Mountain Summer Workshop on Uncertainty Quantification July 15-17, 2015 Attendee SIAM Conference on Computational Science and Engineering March 14-18, 2015 Poster: “Moving Pictures: Animating Still Images” SIAM Front Range Student Conference February 28, 2015 Talk: “Moving Pictures: Animating Still Images” UP-STAT 2014 Mini-Conference (Upstate NY Chapters of the American Statistical Association) April 13, 2014 Talk: “State of Pharma Mutuals” Talk: “Art with Probability Distributions” (Award: Best Fun Statistics Presentation) Geneseo Recognizing Excellence, Achievement, and Talent (GREAT Day) April 8, 2014 Talk: “Pharma Mutuals” Talk: “Making Art with Probability Distributions” Poster: “Moving Pictures: Animating Still Images” Joint Mathematics Meetings 2014 Jan 15-18, 2014 Poster: “Moving Pictures: Animating Still Images” Talk: MAA Contributed Papers Session - At the Intersection of Mathematics and the Arts COPLAC Northeast Regional Undergraduate Research Conference Oct 25-26, 2013 Poster: “Moving Pictures?

item.title: Technical
item.description: Python lead developer of cbayes contributor and researcher on BET extensive experience generating technical notebooks with varying levels of interactivity familiarity with JupyterHub, JupyterLab deep interest in reproducible open science and removing all friction towards such an end Matlab first language, used for countless projects. I have since moved away from it in favor of open-source alternatives Git familiarity with basic repository management have used Github, Bitbucket, and Gitlab I use it to track changes to nearly all the work I do LaTeX preferred document-generation language (pdfs) basic familiarity with publishing formatting for large documents extensive experience writing technical reports Terminal (Bash/Shell) Almost everything I do with respect to programming happens in a bash shell Much of my work is done remotely through ssh Vim My preferred text-editor and distraction-free organizational tool Adobe Suite experienced in Photoshop for general graphic design (posters, figures) familiar with Illustrator Microsoft Suite comfortable in Excel, though I prefer not to use it for anything related to analyzing data.

item.title: Honors
item.description: 2018 Lynn Bateman Fellowship (CU Denver) Phi Beta Kappa Society 2014, SUNY Geneseo, Alpha Omega Chapter Pi Mu Epsilon Mathematics Honor Society 2014, SUNY Geneseo Golden Key International Honor Society 2014, SUNY Geneseo SUNY Geneseo Award for Excellence in Mathematics 2014 74th annual William Lowell Putnam Math Competition First Place, Pi Mu Epsilon Alpha Delta Chapter Score: 10 2014 University of Rochester Math Olympiad First Place, Pi Mu Epsilon Alpha Delta Chapter

item.title: Employment
item.description: (only showing academic jobs) University of Colorado: Denver (Downtown Campus) Student Teaching Assistant, Calculus I (Aug-Dec 2016) Student Research Assistant (Jan-Aug 2016) “DiaMonD: An Integrated Multifaceted Approach to Mathematics at the Interfaces of Data, Models, and Decisions,” DE-SC0009279 Student Teaching Assistant, Calculus I (Aug-Dec 2015) Tutor, Mathematics Education Research Center (Aug-Dec 2015) Student Research Assistant (Aug 2014-May 2015) “CAREER: Foundations for Understanding and Reaching the Limits of Standard Numerical Linear Algebra,” NSF CCF 1054864 Student Research Assistant (Jun-Aug 2014) “SI2-SSI: Collaborative Research: Sustained Innovation for Linear Algebra Software (SILAS),” NSF ACI 1339797 State University of New York: College at Geneseo Teaching Assistant for Linear Programming & Operations Research (Jan-May 2014) Geneseo Research Foundation Undergraduate STEM Summer Research Fellow (Jun-Aug 2013) Volunteer Data Analyst for As Green As It Gets (Nov-Dec 2012) Private Tutor in Mathematics (Summer-Fall 2013)

item.title: Research
item.description: Solving problems of paramount importance to humanity. Showing, not telling the limitless potential of applied mathematics.
